author: wonho21
body:
# Symptom

Change the Powershell 7 font to D2Coding. [https://github.com/naver/d2codingfont](url)

In the <Defaults> menu (Console Windows Properties), the D2Coding font is visible.

However, in the <Properties> menu ("Powershell 7 (x64)" Properties), the D2Coding font is not visible, and fonts such as Consolas are visible.

Consolas and Lucida Console do not contain Korean font information, so Korean characters are not displayed as desired.

I think this is a bug. It doesn't happen on Windows 10.


If you compare it to Windows Powershell on the same server, you can clearly see the difference.

# Comparison : Windows Powershell vs Powershell 7

![Image of Defaults Menu](https://s3-ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/ftt-img.four33.com-tok/github-PS-Defaults.png)

![Image of Properties Menu](https://s3-ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/ftt-img.four33.com-tok/github-PS-Properties.png)
